etymologies: early 17th century: from obsolete French infallibilité or medieval Latin infallibilitas (based on Latin fallere ‘deceive’)

definitions: the quality of being infallible; the inability to be wrong

examples.text: his judgment became impaired by faith in his own infallibility

definitions: (in the Roman Catholic Church) the doctrine that in specified circumstances the Pope is incapable of error in pronouncing dogma.
shortDefinitions: (in Roman Catholic Church) doctrine that in specified circumstances Pope is incapable of error in pronouncing dogma
